JISA.Devices

Class MCSMU

  • java.lang.Object
    • JISA.VISA.VISADevice
      • JISA.Devices.SMU
        • JISA.Devices.MCSMU
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<SMU>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DummyMCSMU, K2600B, SMUCluster

    public abstract class MCSMU
extends SMU
implements java.lang.Iterable<SMU>
    Abstract class defining the standard interface for controller Multiple-Channel SMUs.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  MCSMU.MCUpdateHandler 
      class  MCSMU.Sweep
      Class for configuring then executing multi-channel sweeps
      class  MCSMU.VirtualSMU
      Class for controlling an MCSMU channel as if it were a separate SMU

      Performs a linear sweep of either VOLTAGE or CURRENT, returning the V-I data points as an array of MCIVPoint objects whilst allowing you to keep track of the sweep's progress via a ProgressMonitor object.

      • doLinearSweep

        public IVPoint[] doLinearSweep(int channel,
                               SMU.Source source,
                               double min,
                               double max,
                               int numSteps,
                               long delay,
                               boolean symmetric)
                        throws DeviceException,
                               java.io.IOException
        Performs a linear sweep of either VOLTAGE or CURRENT, returning the V-I data points as an array of MCIVPoint objects
        Parameters:
        channel - Channel number to do sweep on
        source - VOLTAGE or CURRENT
        min - Minimum source value
        max - Maximum source value
        numSteps - Number of steps in sweep
        delay - Amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait before taking each measurement
        symmetric - Should we sweep back to starting point after sweeping forwards?
        Returns:
        Array of MCIVPoint objects containing I-V data points
        Throws:
        DeviceException - Upon incompatibility with device
        java.io.IOException - Upon communications error

      • doLinearSweep

        public IVPoint[] doLinearSweep(int channel,
                               SMU.Source source,
                               double min,
                               double max,
                               int numSteps,
                               long delay,
                               boolean symmetric,
                               SMU.ProgressMonitor onUpdate)
                        throws DeviceException,
                               java.io.IOException
        Performs a linear sweep of either VOLTAGE or CURRENT, returning the V-I data points as an array of MCIVPoint objects whilst allowing you to keep track of the sweep's progress via a ProgressMonitor object.
        Parameters:
        channel - Channel number to do sweep on
        source - VOLTAGE or CURRENT
        min - Minimum source value
        max - Maximum source value
        numSteps - Number of steps in sweep
        delay - Amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait before taking each measurement
        symmetric - Should we sweep back to starting point after sweeping forwards?
        onUpdate - Method to run each time a new measurement is completed
        Returns:
        Array of MCIVPoint objects containing I-V data points
        Throws:
        DeviceException - Upon incompatibility with device
        java.io.IOException - Upon communications error

      • doSweep

        public IVPoint[] doSweep(SMU.Source source,
                         double[] values,
                         long delay,
                         boolean symmetric,
                         SMU.ProgressMonitor onUpdate)
                  throws DeviceException,
                         java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: SMU
        Performs a sweep of either VOLTAGE or CURRENT using specific values, returning data as an array of IVPoint objects.
        Overrides:
        doSweep in class SMU
        Parameters:
        source - VOLTAGE or CURRENT
        values - Array of values to use in the sweep
        delay - Amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait before taking each measurement
        symmetric - Should we sweep back to starting point after sweeping forwards?
        onUpdate - Method to run each time a new measurement is completed (on separate thread)
        Returns:
        Array of IVPoint objects containing V-I data points
        Throws:
        DeviceException - Upon incompatibility with device
        java.io.IOException - Upon communications error
